title: Prohibition: exploiting vulnerabilities (age/disability/social-economic) causing significant harm

article_refs.quote: the placing on the market, the putting into service or the use of an AI system that exploits any of the vulnerabilities of a natural person or a specific group of persons due to their age, disability or a specific social or economic situation, with the objective, or the effect, of materially distorting the behaviour of that person or a person belonging to that group in a manner that causes or is reasonably likely to cause that person or another person significant harm;

legal_consequence.verbatim: Prohibited: AI systems exploiting vulnerabilities due to age, disability, or specific social/economic situation, leading to material distortion causing or likely causing significant harm.

items.label: Recital (28) — manipulative/exploitative practices
items.text: AI misuse can include exploitative practices; such practices should be prohibited due to fundamental rights concerns.

items.label: Recital (29) — exploiting vulnerabilities
items.text: Exploitation of vulnerabilities due to age, disability, or a specific social/economic situation (e.g., extreme poverty, minorities) may materially distort behaviour and cause significant harms without requiring intent.

question.prompt: Does Article 2 scope apply (and no exclusion)?
Is it an AI system under Art. 3?
Does the system exploit such vulnerabilities?

nodes.label: Causes or likely causes significant harm
